metadata.title: Trivia Quiz
metadata.description: General knowledge questions across various topics
metadata.author: QuizMint

question.text: What is the national animal of Scotland?
question.feedback: The unicorn has been a Scottish heraldic symbol since the 12th century, representing purity, innocence, and power.

question.text: Which is the only food that never spoils?
question.feedback: Honey's low moisture content and acidic pH create an inhospitable environment for bacteria, allowing it to last indefinitely when properly sealed.

question.text: How many keys are on a standard piano?
question.feedback: A standard modern piano has 88 keys: 52 white keys and 36 black keys, covering seven octaves plus a minor third.

question.text: What is the only planet in our solar system that rotates clockwise?
question.feedback: Venus rotates on its axis in the opposite direction to most planets, which is often attributed to a collision with another body during its formation.

question.text: What color is a giraffe's tongue?
question.feedback: A giraffe's tongue is blue-black, which is believed to protect it from sunburn as they spend many hours using their tongues to gather food in the sun.
